intro: Magnistipula butayei subsp. balingenbaensis, commonly known as the Balingenbaeng magnistipula, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lanceolate leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in mountainous regions with high biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
